txt.en: 'This must be Shathur-munzu. We know not what lies inside, but it is my charge to clear it of anyone or anything that would bring harm to Lady Arwen. When you are ready, we will enter.'

You find yourself in a den of wargs and Orc-kind. Baradal is nowhere to be seen, and it is very likely she is in grave danger.\n\nYou should make your way through Shathur-munzu and find her before it is too late. Be wary; Ránulur the warg chieftain, or the 'Shadow-hunter', as he is known to the locals, may still be near.
The time has come to enter Shathur-munzu.\n\nYou should complete 'Instance: The Shadow Hunter.'
Baradal is somewhere inside Shathur-munzu. She may be in danger.\n\nYou should find Baradal.
Baradal is locked inside a cage in Shathur-munzu, injured and in danger.\n\nYou should attempt to break open her cage.

Baradal is barely conscious. She stirs as you approach.

'[placeholder]...? Where am I?'

She is still dazed from the warg attack. You should find a way to get her out of this cage before Ránulur returns.
It seems this lock is too sturdy to be opened by force. You will need to find the key. It is probably being carried by an Orc or goblin somewhere inside Shathur-munzu.
Somewhere inside Shathur-munzu, an Orc holds the key to Baradal's cage.\n\nYou should find and defeat the Orc jailor.
Now that you have the key, you should return to Baradal's cage and try to open it.
Baradal has been freed from her cage.\n\nYou should talk to Baradal.
This key looks like it may open the lock on Baradal's cage
The time has come to see what lies inside Shathur-munzu. Whatever awaits, your goal is to clear it of danger for Lady Arwen's arrival.
The lock springs open, freeing Baradal
'[placeholder], I think I am recovering my senses. What has happened?'
